reviewText: Great movie, old version. Somewhat different from book but then describing things in a book easier then filming it.
So dated, sexist, couldn't watch it. Managed 15-20' then had to quit.

What I liked the most about it was just seeing how they wrote scripts in the 1930's.  The dialogue is so different than anything made in the past 40 years.  I also enjoyed watching the primitive special effects. So I'd say it was interesting as a sociological phenomenon.
Unfortunately I just don't think they did a great job of telling the story.
The quality of the film was poor. Very boring and I do not recommend this film to anyone.  I like to have my money back. Thank you
A great adaptation of the Hemingway classic with Gary Cooper playing the lead brilliantly!
One of those war stories that makes you think. Great production, great actors.
